RumorFact.Text: A space station orbiting a planet around a green star.

ExploreFact.Text: This space station is a Nomai anomaly research facility orbiting a planet named Emerald Reverie around a green star called Verdant Beacon.

RumorFact.Text: A domed chamber with panoramic views of space. It contains a warp receiver and a path leading deeper into the station.

ExploreFact.Text: A computer in the dome mentions a dormant elevator system on the lower floor requiring multiple anomaly keys to activate. The key slots are right next to the computer.
A computer in the dome lists four anomaly chambers connected to the station’s ring corridor. Each chamber is said to contain a key that unlocks the elevator system.

RumorFact.Text: The central chamber contains an inactive elevator pad.

ExploreFact.Text: A Nomai log suggests that inserting four anomaly keys will activate the elevator to a lower chamber.
Each of the four anomaly chambers contains a unique puzzle. Solving one causes a key to emerge, which may be part of the security system for this station.
The station must be powered for the elevator to work.
I used the elevator to descend to a sealed chamber below the station once the anomaly keys were gathered.

RumorFact.Text: Nomai notes hint at a chamber where sound loops back unnaturally.
The Nomai referred to it as the Echo Cell.

ExploreFact.Text: The Echo Cell is a floating device that records and replays sounds it hears, often with eerie precision.
When I remain still, it replays earlier noises from their original positions.
Solving the sound puzzle in this chamber unlocked an anomaly key.

RumorFact.Text: Nomai logs describe symbols that respond to the observer's position.
The Nomai referred to it as the Runic Wall.

ExploreFact.Text: This chamber contains six uniquely colored rune panels arranged in a ring. Photographing four of them in the correct order unlocks the mechanism.
If all six aren't visible at once, they swap positions.
The solution is hidden in the room itself. Clues match the color of the runes and suggest the directional sequence to follow.
Photographing four in the correct color sequence unlocked the key.

RumorFact.Text: One chamber is said to contain crystals that bend light.
The Nomai referred to it as the Prism Bloom.

ExploreFact.Text: This chamber contains reflective crystals that redirect energy beams. Light interacts with sensors in the room.
Aligning the prisms to redirect beams to all sensors unlocked an anomaly key.

RumorFact.Text: Nomai notes describe a strange orb that replays short bursts of movement like a phantom double.
The Nomai referred to it as the Memory Orb.

ExploreFact.Text: This orb records my actions and recreates them as a translucent clone.
There are two pressure pads on opposite sides of the room, too far apart to activate alone.
I used the playback to press two pressure pads at once. When both were activated, it revealed an anomaly key.

RumorFact.Text: The elevator seems to lead to lower floor.

ExploreFact.Text: This massive chamber contains a single anomaly: a cube suspended in stasis fields, humming with faint power.
A log left by a Nomai researcher warns of activating the containment field. They refer to it only as "Object 003 – The Box."
Interacting with the containment controls ends the loop early, returning me to the beginning of the cycle.
